text: Thanks to dsandanato for sharing. Pours Cloudy golden color with white head. Aroma is pineapple and citrus. Flavor is pineapple, fresh oranges. With Mineral notes, grapefruit and pine finish. Very excited to try this beer and it lived up to the hype.

[ bottle ][ 1.5oz ][ @Tasting ][ $? ][ mini snifter ][ 05.01.16 ] 
hazy straw, glowing with thin dense white head, good lacing. Dusty pine and grass, dank nose, light cereal grains balance nicely. Heavy grass and pine amidst thick, dusty profile. Amazing balance.

750 ml bottle. Pours a hazy rusty amber color with a medium off white head. Aroma of floral notes, hops, cantaloupe and tropical fruit. Taste of the Fort Point Ale, yet happier and with a hint of spice.
Opaque hazy apricot pour, nice white head. Amazing aroma of mango and grapefruit; flavor of grapefruit, mango, pine and pot. Bitter but fruity. Very creamy with a sharp finish. Fantastic.

750ml bottle pours a pulpy pineapple yellow with some frothy, white head. Nose has tropical fruit, grass, mango, guava. Flavor is sweet, fruity, lemony, grass, mango, guava. Finishes dry and a little creamy.

750 ml bottle at the DC RateBeer Tasting, thanks argo0! Hazy yellow with off-white head. Aromas of lemon and grapefruit citrus, floral notes. Tastes of lemon and grapefruit citrus, floral notes, tropical fruit. Medium body with a dry finish.

Bottle pour at the May 1st DC Tasting. Poured a hazy golden color with a small off-white head. Aroma was light citrus, touch of tropical fruit notes. Floral, juicy, light sweet notes of citrus. Very tasty.
From a bottle at the DC gathering May 1, 2016. Pours a hazy gold with an off white head. Aroma of juicy citrus. Flavors of pineapple, grapefruit and mandarin orange. Lovely
Bottle. Hazy to cloudy yellow color, bright white head. Nice aroma of floral fruity meadows. Taste is overripe fruit, haystacks. Delicious.

75cl bottle. Hazy apple juice bottle topped by medium off-white head. Aroma is medium sweet, some grapefruit, orange, light spicy. Taste is moderately sweet, grapefruit, some bread, spicy. Light-medium body, some effervescence.
Bottle thanks to Josh. Pours a cloudy yellow with medium frothy white head that lasts. The aroma is tropical fruit and dank hops. Medium mouth, juicy hop, dank, nice bitterness, very good.

Bottle thanks to WillRunForBeer. Bottles 3/30/16. Aroma is loads of melon, raspberry, and white wine. Tastes the same. Unique hop for sure. Its mostly creamy melon but the white grape and raspberry are noticeable. Medium to full body makes this a juicy, big beer. Its really good but Im guessing others will love it more than me.

Bottle. Pours cloudy Arnold Palmer, medium white creamy head, good lacing. Aroma is melon, pine, a bit tropical. Flavor is light sweet, light plus bitter, juicy piney melons. Medium body, creamy mouthfeel. Another great one.

Hazy amber-gold color, moderate off-white head. Citrus pith, melon, pine, and some overripte cantaloupe. A little bit of sweetness initially, then moderately bitter. Crisp and light, lively carb, and a somewhat dry finish.

Unbelievable explosion of flavors. Citrusy bitterness is superb. Color is very light caramel. Not able to see through it. Will have it again! 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Pours hazy gold into a tulip. White head recedes to nothing. Pineapple and mango aromas. Soft with sweet caramel, yeast and pineapple front to back. Lasting pith and meringue finish.

Bottle in a tulip. Pours cloudy golden with a big, white head like all Trillium beers. Aroma of strong fruity and citrusy hops, some pale malts, and light dough. Flavor the same with an amazing hoppiness. Average texture. Another awesome beer from Trillium.

This was my favorite of the four Trillium beers we opened this session. Cloudy orange pour with smaller head. Flavor is dirty skunk along with insanely funky hop. Guessing this enigma is like galaxy cause it has some light cat pee, cheese, light onion, cantaloupe. grapefruit, and pine resin.
Poured from bottle thanks ClarkVV cloudy orange bronze with a 2 finger off white head. Aromas of juicy hops and fruit smells great. Taste is insanely good and is well balanced.

650 ml bottle, thanks to ClarkVV on this bottled on 21 Nov, 2015. Mildly hazy gold color with big, full, thick head. Aroma is awesome! The Australian hops are white grape, herbal with some more fruits, pineapple with mild hay.
Flavor is a pretty much a reflection of the aroma. Every single variant of Fort Point has been off the chain! I love Australian hops and this falls in line with Nelson. Very good!

UPDATED: NOV 29, 2015 750ml bottle 11/21/15 shared by ClarkVV. Thabks, Clark! Pours cloudy orange gold with an off white head. Aroma is orange, white grape and black pepper. Flavor is soft, orange, pepper, mild caramel. Orange peel in the finish. 
Note: Mass rate #300.

Thanks Clark for sharing. 750ML bottle. enjoyed @ outside temp so around 40F? this is super cloudy, its this bronze orange 2 finger off-white head. The nose is like this grape-forward, with a ton of tropical fruits. This is insane. Juicy, bright, a lot of pine resin and it has this citrus skin like when you chew on orange skin its this tight acidity. good mouthfeel. insanely awesome. the malt and hop presence is very light and very tame.
Dark orange and cloudy. Lots of white foamy head. Smell is orange juice. Taste is pretty juicy with fruits and well balanced bitter hops. So good.

UPDATED: DEC 3, 2015 750mL bottled and drunk on 11/21/15.Well, this is pretty fresh, thats for sure. Big white head and cloudy appearance as is well-established by now. Great retention.Nose seems less given to any green onion or garlic than the other varieties of Fort Point. Really nice pineapple and kiwi in the nose, with some definite dankness and herbal qualities. Honey and sweet biscuits show through from the malts, balancing nicely. No yeast stink, cat pee or b vitamin here. No alcohol noted.Juicy and very tropical but with an additional dryness that some of the other varieties didnt have. No resin, thankfully and none of that galaxy tang/capsaicin-like quality. Dankness meets guava and key lime in a really nice flavor profile. Awesome texture and balance as always, with tight carbonation and a great creaminess to it. Aside from the regular version, this is my favorite (though they are all so similar).Second bottle, drunk 11/28/15.Ya, I suspected I had underrated this and so I had.  Just much, much more brightly hopped than any of the other variants, by a longshot.  Really unique with watermelon, guava and meyer lemon and just enough bitterness in the flavor.  Perfect texture/carbonation as always.  Probably have the regular Fort Point a bit lower than it should be too.  Will definitely pick up a new bottle of a forthcoming batch of that and rerate it.

Bottle thanks to FooFaa. Nose is grassy with soft fruitiness. Some light citrus. Moderately hazy golden color with a medium sized white head. Taste is like an orange creamsicle, almost hints of vanilla, subtle bitterness. Very nice.

Pours a bright golden yellow, medium fluffy head. Aroma is melon, onion, grass, pineapple, grass. Flavor is the same, gooey fruits, scallion. Really top notch, my first dance with Enigma... Not too scary, I like.
